private_information: I specialize in distilling action schemas with clear predicate signatures and consistent parameter ordering.
I maintain canonical predicate names and arities: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
I ensure actions expose preconditions, add effects, and delete effects without ambiguity.
schema_analyst.goal: Extract precise action schemas and predicate signatures from the public description, producing a structured summary suitable for building PDDL later.

private_information: I construct concrete instances: object sets, initial states, goals, and plan traces.
I align objects and facts to the schema while preserving exact naming for full interoperability.
I can validate the given plan against the schema at the fact level and compute any missing implied facts that are needed.
instance_builder.goal: Assemble the two instance specifications (S1 and S2) including objects, initial facts, goals, and the provided plan for S1, formatted as structured data that is ready to be transformed into PDDL problems.

private_information: I integrate action schemas and instances into a coherent PDDL domain and problem files.
I target the Fast Downward solver and will ensure the PDDL uses only features supported by STRIPS with negative effects.
I will keep action names and predicate names exactly as provided and avoid introducing new symbols unless strictly necessary.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (S1 and S2) targeting the Fast Downward solver, strictly matching the action schemas and instance data.

public_information: Domain overview: You can manipulate a set of objects via actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. The state uses predicates: hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y).
Action paltry(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.
Action sip(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action clip(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2. Effects add: vase o0 o1. Effects delete: next o0 o2.
Action wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3): Preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action memory(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted(o0,o1,o2): Preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1. Effects add: next o0 o2. Effects delete: vase o0 o1.

STATEMENT S1 initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_9, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_9, next object_13 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
STATEMENT S1 goal: next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_9.

STATEMENT S1 plan: clip object_12 object_5 object_9; clip object_10 object_5 object_9; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; wretched object_5 object_9 object_8 object_3; clip object_11 object_5 object_8; memory object_1 object_6 object_8; paltry object_13 object_1 object_8; clip object_13 object_5 object_8; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_8; tightfisted object_10 object_5 object_8; wretched object_5 object_8 object_9 object_3; tightfisted object_13 object_5 object_9; tightfisted object_11 object_5 object_9; sip object_12 object_1 object_8; sip object_10 object_1 object_8; memory object_1 object_8 object_6; paltry object_12 object_1 object_6; paltry object_10 object_1 object_6; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; clip object_12 object_4 object_6; wretched object_4 object_6 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_7.

STATEMENT S2 initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_8, next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_9, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
STATEMENT S2 goal: next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_9.

analyze_schema.system_prompt: You analyze planning domains from natural descriptions and produce a clean, lossless, and unambiguous structured summary of predicates and actions. Output a single JSON object with keys: predicates (list of {name, arity, signature}), actions (list of {name, parameters, preconditions, add_effects, del_effects}). Do not emit PDDL in this step.
analyze_schema.prompt: Your name is schema_analyst. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->schema_analyst->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->schema_analyst->goal}. Extract the exact predicate signatures and the six actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameter names and consistent ordering that matches the public description. Return a single compact JSON summary only; do not emit PDDL.

prepare_instances.system_prompt: You build grounded instances that adhere strictly to a given action schema. Provide a single JSON object containing: objects (list), S1 {init (list of atoms), goal (list of atoms), plan (ordered list of grounded actions)}, S2 {init (list of atoms), goal (list of atoms)}. Validate that the S1 plan is schema-consistent step by step; include a field plan_valid with value true or false and, if false, explain the first failing step in a field plan_violation. Do not emit PDDL in this step.
prepare_instances.prompt: Your name is instance_builder. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->instance_builder->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->instance_builder->goal}. Use the schema from {schema_summary} to assemble objects, S1 initial facts and goal, the provided S1 plan, and S2 initial facts and goal. Keep all symbol names exactly as given and return the JSON package only; do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-instance PDDL targeting the Fast Downward solver. You produce a single response that contains one PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files, each enclosed in tags: <domain>...</domain> and for each instance <problem id="S1">...</problem> and <problem id="S2">...</problem>. Requirements: use :strips and allow negative effects; avoid typing unless clearly specified; avoid quantifiers and conditional effects; keep predicate and action names exactly as provided; keep parameter ordering consistent with the schema; include only symbols that exist in the schema and instances. The problems must include all objects (object_0 to object_13) and list initial facts and goals exactly as in the instances. Ensure the output is ready to be fed to Fast Downward.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action schema and instances to generate a final PDDL domain and two problems for Fast Downward. Inputs to integrate: {schema_summary} and {instances_pack}. Preserve symbol names and parameter orders precisely. Validate the provided S1 plan against the generated domain and include, after the PDDL sections, a brief plain-text note indicating whether the S1 plan is valid or the first point of failure; do not include any additional formatting beyond the tags and the closing note.
